p: Similar results (as that of CAs) were obtained for SCE and the results are presented in Table 5. The lymphocyte cultures exposed to A. paniculata extract (50âˆ¼250 mg/mL) did not show any changes in SCE, when compared to normal control. However, the cells co-treated with CPA +EAP showed a significant reduction ( P<0.05 or P< 0.01) in SCEs per chromosome and mean SCEs/cell compared to CPA treated cells. The results again reaffirm the antimutagenic nature and antigenotoxic potential of the extract against CPA.
